pullRequest.body:
Also prove that the composition of continuously polynomial functions is continuously polynomial.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #22102 
- [x] depends on: #22789

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Analytic.Composition | 1583 | 1585 | +2 (+0.13%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Analytic.Composition`|2|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CPolynomialAt.comp`
`+ CPolynomialAt.comp_of_eq`
`+ CPolynomialAt.fun_comp`
`+ CPolynomialAt.fun_comp_of_eq`
`+ CPolynomialOn.comp`
`+ CPolynomialOn.comp'`
`+ HasFiniteFPowerSeriesAt.comp`
`+ _root_.ContinuousMultilinearMap.flipLinear`
`+ analyticAt_uncurry_compContinuousLinearMap`
`+ analyticAt_uncurry_of_linear`
`+ analyticOnNhd_uncurry_compContinuousLinearMap`
`+ analyticOnNhd_uncurry_of_linear`
`+ analyticOn_uncurry_compContinuousLinearMap`
`+ analyticOn_uncurry_of_linear`
`+ analyticWithinAt_uncurry_compContinuousLinearMap`
`+ analyticWithinAt_uncurry_of_linear`
`+ cpolynomialAt_uncurry_compContinuousLinearMap`
`+ cpolynomialAt_uncurry_of_linear`
`+ cpolynomialOn_uncurry_compContinuousLinearMap`
`+ cpolyomialOn_uncurry_of_linear`
`+ flipMultilinearEquiv`
`+ flipMultilinearEquivâ‚—`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@grunweg, thanks! The PR cherry-picking the easy parts is  #22789.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22102~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22789~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
In case you want to, the changes to Mathlib/Analysis/Analytic/CPolynomialDef.lean also LGTM. (Or you can wait for another reviewer to get to this PR.)
I think I've already put the changes to `CPolynomialDef` in #22789. Were you thinking of another file?
Yes, I was, sorry: I meant Mathlib/Analysis/Analytic/Linear.lean

Thanks for your PR! I don't the time to review everything right now, but I see two pieces which you could split off, that I can already approve:
- just the name changes LGTM
- the new code in Mathlib/Analysis/Analytic/CPolynomialDef.lean also LGTM
Feel free to create a sub-PR with either and ask for my review.

Thanks for your PR! I don't the time to review everything right now, but I see two pieces which you could split off, that I can already approve:
- just the name changes LGTM
- the new code in Mathlib/Analysis/Analytic/CPolynomialDef.lean also LGTM
Feel free to create a sub-PR with either and ask for my review.

pullRequest.title: feat: composing a continuous multilinear map with continuous linear maps is analytic in both variables
